definition: dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: You slobbered all over me on the News Line New York!
sentences.chinese: 你却在纽约新闻热线里对我表现得如此露骨。

sentences.english: Explicit sex is on show in the temples, while the movies don't even get to first base.
sentences.chinese: 露骨的性爱在寺庙里上演，而电影甚至不能达到一垒。

sentences.english: Barefaced attitude is exceeding and ambiguous fetching illusion is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 露骨的姿态极度暧昧引人幻想无限。

sentences.english: Hitler's undisguised effort to persecute the Jews met with worldwide condemnation.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒对犹太人的露骨迫害行为受到全世界的谴责。

sentences.english: More potent than such equivocations, though, may be the threat of social unrest.
sentences.chinese: 但是比这个更露骨的话则有可能引起社会动荡。

sentences.english: The website carried a warning about explicit content.
sentences.chinese: 该网站还附有公告，提醒读者短信内容露骨。

sentences.english: The utterance of female later netizen is more and more barefaced however, measure jumps over Liao Yuekuan.
sentences.chinese: 后来女网友的言语却越来越露骨，尺度越聊越宽。

sentences.english: The sentence is not unusual in the real undisguised.
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的一句话却真实得露骨。

sentences.english: We don’t want to get too graphic here, but going overboard is kind of a turn off.
sentences.chinese: 我们不想要在这里太过露骨，但物极必反。

sentences.english: Some politicians will tell their voters many barefaced lies.
sentences.chinese: 一些政客会对选民说出许多公然露骨的谎言。

sentences.english: The angulus oris laughing at is bringing the barefaced pallor along.
sentences.chinese: 嘴角悳笑带著露骨悳苍白。

sentences.english: Someone held that Qian's deeds were flagrantly anti-party.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为，钱三强是更加露骨地反对党的领导。

sentences.english: The most furious anarchist become the most barefaced apostate .
sentences.chinese: 最激烈的无政府主义者，居然成了最露骨的变节者。

definition: to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
